ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a sunshade.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.4_0: “How can the monks from the group of six give teachings to people holding a sunshade?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.8_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.10_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.11.1_0: ‘“I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.12_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.1_0: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not give teachings to sick people holding a sunshade.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.2.1_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.3_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics not give teachings to sick people holding a sunshade?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.4_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.6_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.7_0: “Monks, I allow you to give a teaching to someone who’s sick holding a sunshade.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.8_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.9.1_0: ‘“I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade who is not sick,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.11_0: there are three kinds of sunshade: the white sunshade, the reed sunshade, the leaf sunshade. They are bound at the rim and bound at the ribs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.13_0: what has been spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by sages, what has been spoken by gods, what is connected with what is beneficial, what is connected with the Teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.15_0: if he teaches by the line, then for every line he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.16_0: If he teaches by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.17_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.18_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a sunshade who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.19.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.21_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.22_0: The seventh training rule is finished.
